Nong’s Khao Man Gai Review | Bon Appetit









































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLoginportlandNong’s Khao Man GaiA mini restaurant empire dedicated to Thai chicken and riceFacebookPinterestTwitterEmailRathdavanh Photography GO HERE: for Bangkok native Nong Poonsukwattan’s soul-nourishing chicken and rice dish that’s got a cult following at Nong’s Khao Man Gai.ORDER THE: namesake dish, of course! Her faithful rendition of khao man gai is comprised of gently poached chicken served with aromatic rice cooked in chicken stock; a garlicky, spicy sauce for dipping; cucumbers; cilantro; and a little bit of chicken broth. There is a vegetarian version and Coca-Cola-braised pork, but you’re really here for the khao man gai. It’s heavenly.THE VIBE IS: leisurely at the brick-and-mortar shops, with lots of counter-top stools by the big windows and small four-top tables, and more lively at the canary yellow food cart, where you’ll still find crowds lining up for khao man gai.PRACTICAL STUFF: Check the website for the opening times and addresses at the three locations (two brick-and-mortar outposts and one food cart).—Elyse InamineWE ALSO LOVEHà VL SandwichSoul-warming soups that will brighten the rainiest day Pizza JerkThe man behind Bunk Sandwiches gives PDX a pizzeria like none otherAfuriA Japanese ramen chain we hope conquers AmericaExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
